title: Crypt0Gore
author: Crypt0Gore
content: Do you think that decentralised social platform like Twitter is a good idea in crypto space? I am looking into DeSo Ecosystem where your recovery seed is all you need to sign into the network and you get paid for all good contents you create on the platform .Users can tip content creators among themselves using DeSo coin, I am not here to shill this project, I just want to know what people feel about the future of this project.

Though, it looks like it's okay to buy him even if it's just a little bit.That's why we still need to use dianamondapp to access the Deso ecosystem, based on what I read on their Twitter page https://twitter.com/search?q=Deso%20ecosystem&src=typed_query

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: This concept isn't new. There are some websites already where you interact with another users through posts and articles while being possible to earn money with this. Examples: Medium and Publish0x.Futurely Twitter may add the tipping feature to the platform as well.Therefore, in my opinion it's hard for a new platform offering this same feature to thrive. It's a very banal usage for justifying the launchment of a new altcoin, since you can already have access to consolidated websites like the ones mentioned above.

comments.author: masulum
comments.body: social finance, or any decentralized social platform mostly ended. because we are already have a lot of related project since 2017, but in the end, they are going die. Twitter will be better to use than the new one. Some project offered a tip for a blog post and vlog, but the mechanism is not decentralized as the concept of blockchain. Not to underestimating a project, but with this concept, will be hard to get attentions.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: Projects like this had been tried and announced in this forum, they used to mimic Facebook, Youtube, and other social media platform but ended up having no users and soon after the project died.  I think it doesn't matter whether a platform is decentralized or centralized, what matters is that it has users.  Tons of users make advertisements profitable so that it can maintain the reward ecosystem.  In the end, any copycat will never be better than the one it copies unless it gives innovations and easier access to the users.

The problem is when you are not even having so many demands in your platforms and you will be alone. There's no need for people to use new platform like that. It's only gimmick i guess. It means nothing rather than a new project that became money grabber only.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on November 18, 2022, 07:47:07 AMDo you think that decentralised social platform like Twitter is a good idea in crypto space? I am looking into DeSo Ecosystem where your recovery seed is all you need to sign into the network and you get paid for all good contents you create on the platform .Users can tip content creators among themselves using DeSo coin, I am not here to shill this project, I just want to know what people feel about the future of this project.I don't trust that these systems would catch up even a fraction of twitter userbase anytime soon. As long as you need to sign in with a wallet or buy eth or whatever to do that it would drive most people away. And people attract more people to join so if it's a ghost town, no-one enjoys spending their time with there.This has happened even with working platforms. Google+ was a good idea and it has a change to challenge major platforms, but everyone was expecting everyone else to write content. There wasnt enough people using it and rest of them left. And that was EASY to use. And we might think that some decentralized places are easier to use now then they were few years ago but that doesn't really help when we are talking about people who aren't diginatives.
